resources.string: Voting helps keep the government accountable and representative.

1. Check your eligibility. 

 You are eligible to vote if you will be 18+ by election day, are a US citizen, meet your state's residency requirements, and are registered by your state's voter registration deadline. In some states, you still may not be eligible to vote if you have been convicted of a felony or are mentally incapacitated (please check with your state elections office). 
 

 2. Check your registration. 

 If you are under 18, you can pre-register to vote in some jurisdictions.
3. Submit your ballot before the deadline. \n\n Visit the \"find my polling place\" tab to find ballot boxes and polls and refer to the timeline below for your jurisdiction\'s voting deadlines.
